description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2d5ut","text":"This protocol is the methodology that we have successfully employed to generate and confirm insertion deletion mutants in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351. Attached to the protocol is a file that includes primers for the srtA mutation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":122,"length":21},{"style":"italic","offset":150,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":235,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5v429","text":"      \nCreation of a plasmid construct","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"cdq76","text":"The regions upstream and downstream of the region to be deleted were amplified
using primers 1 and 2, and 3 and 4, respectively. These primers were designed
to contain appropriate overhangs to allow In-fusion with pJET 1.2/blunt and the
antibiotic resistance cassette.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d0uul","text":"The spectinomycin resistance cassette (aad9) was amplified using\nprimers S1 and S2 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":39,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8tjlq","text":"PCR products were then purified with a Qiagen PCR Purification Kit  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2h77q","text":"The three fragments for each mutant construct were cloned into pDRIVE using In-Fusion Snap Assembly (Takara) and transformed into Escherichia coli stellar competent cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ek491","text":"Transformants were selected on LB agar plates supplemented with ampicillin (100 µg/ml) and incubated at 37oC overnight","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":106,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7hnjl","text":"The resulting colonies were confirmed as ampicillin resistant by streaking on a new LB agar plate supplemented with ampicillin (100 µg/ml).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"43cb4","text":" Transformants were screened by colony PCR using M13 Forward and Reverse primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d780l","text":"Transformation of S. mitis B6","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29},{"style":"italic","offset":18,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a88pt","text":"For transformants giving an appropriate PCR product, a 5 mL LB culture supplemented with ampicillin (100 µg/ml) was grown overnight at 37 °C with shaking at 200 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1hp53","text":"The plasmid was then purified using Qiagen Miniprep Kit and confirmed by sequencing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"akl83","text":"Strains were growth at 37°C in C+Y pH8 [1] – starting at a low inoculum i.e. from a plate or diluting from a culture 1:100 (starting optical density at 600nm [OD600] = 0.03 to 0.05).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":161,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bd9sl","text":"When the culture was close to OD600 =0.1, 950 μl of C+Y pH 8.0 medium was added to a 1.5 ml tube with 10 μl of 100 mM CaCl2, 2 μl of competence stimulating peptide (CSP) (DKRLPYFFKHLFSNRTK - 1 mg/ml), and 150 ng of DNA. A no DNA control tube is included as a negative control.  These tubes were prewarmed in a waterbath to 37°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":32,"length":3},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":171,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9lju6","text":"When the culture reached an OD600 of 0.12, 50 μl of culture was added to the prewarmed tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":30,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ad7v","text":"Tubes were incubated in a waterbath at 37 °C for 2 hr. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e3m6g","text":"Reactions were pelleted by centrifugation and resuspended in approximately 100 µl of media. This was plated on selective Tryptic Soy Agar (TSA) plates spread with 5000 U catalase (Worthington Biochemical Corporation).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ugtm","text":"Plates were incubated at 37oC in 5% CO2 overnight and then patched onto selective plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bu554","text":"Confirmation of putative transformants","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bd8i1","text":" Putative transformants were grown in tryptic soy broth and DNA prepared as previously described [2]. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Mutant generation in Streptococcus oralis strain S.mitis/oralis 351
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5hbsn","text":"The mutations were confirmed by PCR and sequencing (using primers 5 and 6). Genetic background was confirmed by repetitive extragenic palindromic PCR [3].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
